## Part I: Context

## Part II: Content

## Part III: Code

Below, we will run through an entire analysis using the `gssr` package.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# install packages
install.packages("remotes", repos = "http://cran.us.r-project.org")
install.packages("tidyverse", repos = "http://cran.us.r-project.org")
install.packages("tidyr", repos = "http://cran.us.r-project.org")

# load gssr package
remotes::install_github("kjhealy/gssr")

# load libraries
library(gssr)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
```
:::


#### Explore variables in the GSSR documentation file


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# load the master documentation files
data(gss_all) # note that this is a large file of all GSS data
data(gss_doc) # this is the documentation for the GSS data

# check which years your variables are available
gss_which_years(gss_all, race)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 33 × 2
    year race 
   <dbl> <lgl>
 1  1972 TRUE 
 2  1973 TRUE 
 3  1974 TRUE 
 4  1975 TRUE 
 5  1976 TRUE 
 6  1977 TRUE 
 7  1978 TRUE 
 8  1980 TRUE 
 9  1982 TRUE 
10  1983 TRUE 
# ℹ 23 more rows
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# view information on a specific variable
gss_doc %>% filter(id == "race") %>% 
  select(id, description, text)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 1 × 3
  id    description        text                                   
  <chr> <chr>              <chr>                                  
1 race  Race of respondent 24. What race do you consider yourself?
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
gss_doc %>% filter(id == "sex") %>% 
  select(id, description, text)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 1 × 3
  id    description     text                     
  <chr> <chr>           <chr>                    
1 sex   Respondents sex 23. Code respondent's sex
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
gss_doc %>% filter(id == "hrs2") %>% 
  select(id, description, text)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 1 × 3
  id    description                         text                                
  <chr> <chr>                               <chr>                               
1 hrs2  Number of hours usually work a week 1b. If with a job, but not at work:…
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
gss_doc %>% filter(id == "educ") %>% 
  select(id, description, text)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 1 × 3
  id    description                      text                                   
  <chr> <chr>                            <chr>                                  
1 educ  Highest year of school completed 15. What is the highest grade in eleme…
```
:::
:::


#### Use the GSSR dictionary documentation


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# use the dictionary to get information in a different format
data(gss_dict)
gss_dict
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 2,469 × 6
     pos variable label                           col_type value_labels years   
   <int> <chr>    <chr>                           <chr>    <chr>        <list>  
 1     1 wrkstat  labor force status              dbl+lbl  [1] working… <tibble>
 2     2 hrs1     number of hours worked last we… dbl+lbl  [89] 80+ ho… <tibble>
 3     3 hrs2     number of hours usually work a… dbl+lbl  [89] 80+ ho… <tibble>
 4     4 evwork   ever work as long as one year   dbl+lbl  [1] yes; [2… <tibble>
 5     5 wrkslf   r self-emp or works for somebo… dbl+lbl  [1] self-em… <tibble>
 6     6 wrkgovt  govt or private employee        dbl+lbl  [1] governm… <tibble>
 7     7 indus80  r's industry code (1980)        dbl+lbl  [1] strongl… <tibble>
 8     8 occ10    r's census occupation code (20… dbl+lbl  [10] chief … <tibble>
 9     9 indus10  r's industry code (naics 2007)  dbl+lbl  [170] crop … <tibble>
10    10 marital  marital status                  dbl+lbl  [1] married… <tibble>
# ℹ 2,459 more rows
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
gss_dict %>% 
  filter(variable == "race")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 1 × 6
    pos variable label              col_type value_labels               years   
  <int> <chr>    <chr>              <chr>    <chr>                      <list>  
1    71 race     race of respondent dbl+lbl  [1] white; [2] black; [3]… <tibble>
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}

  filter(variable == "sex")
```
